tit.e: Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles)
Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles)
Yakusa no Kabane (the eight honorary titles)

sen.j: 八色の姓（やくさのかばね）とは、天武天皇が684年（天武13）に新たに制定した真人（まひと） 朝臣（あそみ・あそん） 宿禰（すくね） 忌寸（いみき）道師（みちのし） 臣（おみ） 連（むらじ） 稲置（いなぎ）の八つの姓の制度のこと。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu established the "Yakusa no Kabane" (the eight honorary titles) system in 684 and the eight titles were Mahito, Asomi/Ason, Sukune, Imiki, Michinoshi, Omi, Muraji, and Inagi.
Yakusa no Kabane refers to the system of eight titles newly established by the Emperor Tenmu in 684; the eight titles were Mahito, Asomi/Ason, Sukune, Imiki, Michinoshi, Omi, Muraji, and Inagi.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Yakusa no Kabane refers to the system of eight titles newly established by the Emperor Tenmu in 684; the eight titles were Mahito, Asomi/Ason, Sukune, Imiki, Michinoshi, Omi, Muraji, and Inagi.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の天武天皇十三年冬十月の条に、以下のような記述がある。
sen.e: The article in November, 684 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) said 'the Emperor made a decree, saying: "The hereditary titles of all the families are reformed and 'Yakusa no Kabane instituted."'
sen.cmt: 天武天皇十三年冬十月の条→the article in November, 684八色の姓→本文内に出てくるこの表現に関しては訳中で''をつけました。『日本書紀』の内容については、一部、'NIHONGI' Chronicles of Japan from the Earliest Times to A.D.697 by W.G.Aston (TUTTLE PUBLISHING)を参考にしました。一原文一訳文の例外
sen.e: The article in November, 684 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) has the following description.
sen.cmt: 原文を分け、英文も編集しました。
sen.e: The article in November, 684 in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) has the following description.

sen.j: 「詔して曰はく、更諸氏の族姓を改めて、八色の姓を作りて、天下の万姓を混（まろか）す。」
sen.e: The Emperor made a decree, saying 'The hereditary titles of all the families are reformed and Yakusa no Kabane instituted.'
sen.cmt: 原文を分け、英文も編集しました。
sen.e: The Emperor made a decree, saying 'The hereditary titles of all the families are reformed and Yakusa no Kabane instituted.'

sen.j: 「一つに曰く、真人。」
sen.e: The First is Mahito.
The First is Mahito.
The First is Mahito.

sen.j: 「二つに曰く、朝臣。」
sen.e: The second, Asomi/Ason.
The second, Asomi/Ason.
The second, Asomi/Ason.

sen.j: 「三つに曰く、宿禰。」
sen.e: The third, Sukune.
The third, Sukune.
The third, Sukune.

sen.j: 「四つに曰く、忌寸。」
sen.e: The fourth, Imiki.
The fourth, Imiki.
The fourth, Imiki.

sen.j: 「五つに曰く、道師。」
sen.e: The fifth, Michinoshi.
The fifth, Michinoshi.
The fifth, Michinoshi.

sen.j: 「六つに曰く、臣。」
sen.e: The sixth, Omi.
The sixth, Omi.
The sixth, Omi.

sen.j: 「七つに曰く、連。」
sen.e: The seventh, Muraji.
The seventh, Muraji.
The seventh, Muraji.

sen.j: 「八つに曰く、稲置。」
sen.e: The eighth, Inagi.
sen.cmt: 原文の」は無視しました。
sen.e: The eighth, Inagi.
The eighth, Inagi.

sen.j: 天武天皇の国風諡号（和風諡号、わふうしごう）は、天渟中原瀛真人天皇（あまのぬなはらおきのまひとのすめらみこと）という。
sen.e: A Japanese-style posthumous name of Emperor Tenmu was Amanonunaharaoki no mahito no sumeramikoto.
sen.cmt: 国風諡号（和風諡号)→訳の中で大きな違いはないと考え、一つの訳で置き換えました。
sen.e: A Japanese-style posthumous name of Emperor Tenmu was Amanonunahara Oki no Mahito no Sumeramikoto.
sen.cmt: あまのぬはら の後でスペースを一部追加しました。
sen.e: A Japanese-style posthumous name of Emperor Tenmu was Amanonunahara Oki no Mahito no Sumeramikoto.

sen.j: 「真人」が使われており、八色の姓の筆頭にあげられている。
sen.e: Mahito' was used for his posthumous name and it was ranked first under the 'Yakusa no Kabane' system.
Among the eight titles 'Mahito' was used and it was ranked first under the Yakusa no Kabane.
sen.cmt: 文頭に一部補足しました。
sen.e: Among the eight titles 'Mahito' was used and it was ranked first under the Yakusa no Kabane.

sen.j: 姓を賜う
sen.e: Titles were given.
Giving titles
sen.cmt: 小タイトル用に表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Giving titles

sen.j: 682年（天武11）8月、官人の考選に族姓を重んじる。
sen.e: August, 682: The hereditary titles were valued to select the government official.
August, 682: The hereditary titles were valued to select the government official.
August, 682: The hereditary titles were valued to select the government official.

sen.j: 683年（天武12）9月、倭直（やまとのあたい）など38氏に連の姓を授ける。
sen.e: September, 683: The title of 'Muraji' was given to 38 clans such as Yamato no atai.
sen.cmt: 倭直→Yamato no atai姓（連）の訳文に''をつけ加えました。
sen.e: September, 683: The title of 'Muraji' was given to 38 clans such as Yamato no atai.
September, 683: The title of 'Muraji' was given to 38 clans such as Yamato no atai.

sen.j: 684年（天武13）10月、守山公・路公・高橋公・三国公・当麻公・茨城公・丹比公・猪名公・坂田公・息長公・羽田公・酒人公・山道公など13氏に真人の姓を授ける。
sen.e: October, 684: The title of 'Mahito' was given to 13 clans, such as Moriyama no kimi, Michi no kimi, Takahashi no kimi, Mikuni no kimi, Tagima no kimi, Ubaraki no kimi, Tajihi no kimi, Ina no kimi, Sakata no kimi, Okinaga no kimi, Hata no kimi, Sakahito no kimi, and Yamaji no kimi.
sen.cmt: 姓（真人）の訳文に''をつけ加えました。守山公→Moriyama no kimi路公→Michi no kimi高橋公→Takahashi no kimi三国公→Mikuni no kimi当麻公→Tagima no kimi茨城公→Ubaraki no kimi丹比公→Tajihi no kimi猪名公→Ina no kimi坂田公→Sakata no kimi息長公→Okinaga no kimi羽田公→Hata no kimi酒人公→Sakahito no kimi山道公→Yamaji no kimihttp://www7a.biglobe.ne.jp/~kamiya1/mypage-s.htm
sen.e: October, 684: The title of 'Mahito' was given to 13 clans, such as Moriyama no kimi, Michi no kimi, Takahashi no kimi, Mikuni no kimi, Tagima no kimi, Ubaraki no kimi, Tajihi no kimi, Ina no kimi, Sakata no kimi, Okinaga no kimi, Hata no kimi, Sakahito no kimi, and Yamaji no kimi.

October, 684: The title of 'Mahito' was given to 13 clans, such as Moriyama no kimi, Michi no kimi, Takahashi no kimi, Mikuni no kimi, Tagima no kimi, Ubaraki no kimi, Tajihi no kimi, Ina no kimi, Sakata no kimi, Okinaga no kimi, Hata no kimi, Sakahito no kimi, and Yamaji no kimi.

sen.j: （公は「きみ」と読む。）
sen.e: 公 is pronounced as 'kimi'.
公 is pronounced as 'kimi'.
公 is pronounced as 'kimi'.

sen.j: 684年（天武13）11月、大三輪君など52氏に朝臣の姓を授ける。
sen.e: November, 684: The title of 'Asomi/Ason' was given to 52 clans such as Omiwa no kimi.
sen.cmt: 大三輪君→Omiwa no kimi姓（朝臣）の訳文に''をつけ加えました。
sen.e: November, 684: The title of 'Asomi/Ason' was given to 52 clans such as Omiwa no kimi.
November, 684: The title of 'Asomi/Ason' was given to 52 clans such as Omiwa no kimi.

sen.j: 12月、大伴連など50氏に宿禰の姓を授ける。
sen.e: December: The title of 'Sukune' was given to 50 clans such as Otomo no muraji.
sen.cmt: 大伴連→Otomo no muraji姓（宿禰）の訳文に''をつけ加えました。
sen.e: December: The title of 'Sukune' was given to 50 clans such as Otomo no muraji.
December: The title of 'Sukune' was given to 50 clans such as Otomo no muraji.

sen.j: 685年（天武14）6月、大和連など11氏に、忌寸の姓を授ける。
sen.e: June, 685: The title of 'Imiki' was given to 11 clans such as Yamato no muraji.
sen.cmt: 大和連→Yamato no muraji姓（忌寸）の訳文に''をつけ加えました。
sen.e: June, 685: The title of 'Imiki' was given to 11 clans such as Yamato no muraji.
June, 685: The title of 'Imiki' was given to 11 clans such as Yamato no muraji.

tit.e: New order of the social status
New order of the social status
New order of the social status

sen.j: 実際に賜ったのは、上の年表にあるように、真人・朝臣・宿禰・忌寸の上位四姓であった。
sen.e: The higher rank of four titles, 'Mahito', 'Asomi/Ason', 'Sukune', and 'Imiki' were actually given as described in the above chronology.
The titles actually given were the higher rank of four titles, 'Mahito,' 'Asomi/Ason,' 'Sukune,' and 'Imiki' described in the above chronology.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: The titles actually given were the higher rank of four titles, 'Mahito,' 'Asomi/Ason,' 'Sukune,' and 'Imiki' described in the above chronology.

sen.j: 旧来の臣・連・伴造（とものみやつこ）・国造（くにのみやつこ）という身分秩序にたいして、臣・連の中から天皇一族と関係の深いものだけを抽出し、真人・朝臣・宿禰の姓を与え、新しい身分秩序を作り出し、皇族の地位を高めた。
sen.e: While the old order of the social status was Omi, Muraji, Tomonomiyatsuko, and Kuninomiyatsuko, the Emperor Tenmu selected only the ones who had a close connection with imperial family from among Omi and Muraji, gave a new titles of Mahito, Asomi/Ason, and Sukune to them, created a new order of the social status, and raised the status of imperial family.
sen.cmt: 主語にEmperor Tenmuを加えました。
sen.e: While the old order of the social status was Omi, Muraji, Tomonomiyatsuko, and Kuninomiyatsuko, the Emperor Tenmu selected only the ones who had a close connection with imperial family from among Omi and Muraji, gave a new titles of Mahito, Asomi/Ason, and Sukune to them, created a new order of the social status, and raised the status of imperial family.

While the old order of the social status was Omi, Muraji, Tomonomiyatsuko, and Kuninomiyatsuko, the Emperor Tenmu selected only the ones who had a close connection with imperial family from among Omi and Muraji, gave a new titles of Mahito, Asomi/Ason, and Sukune to them, created a new order of the social status, and raised the status of imperial family.

sen.j: 上級官人と下級官人の家柄を明確にすると共に、中央貴族と地方豪族とをはっきり区別した。
sen.e: The Emperor clarified a family lineage between the superior and lower-level official and made a sharp distinction between the central noble and local powerful clan.
The Emperor clarified a family lineage between the superior and lower-level officials and made a sharp distinction between the central nobles and local powerful clans.
sen.cmt: officials, nobles, clans と複数に変更しました。
sen.e: The Emperor clarified a family lineage between the superior and lower-level officials and made a sharp distinction between the central nobles and local powerful clans.

sen.j: ただし、すべての姓をこの制度に当てはめるということは行われず、従来あった姓はそのまま残された。
sen.e: However, the Emperor did not apply this system to all titles, and remained the existing titles.
However, the Emperor did not apply this system to all titles, and the existing titles remained.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: However, the Emperor did not apply this system to all titles, and the existing titles remained.

sen.j: そのために古くからあった姓、臣・連・伴造（とものみやつこ）・国造（くにのみやっこ）などもそのまま残っていた。
sen.e: Therefore, the old titles such as Omi, Muraji, Tomonomiyatsuko, and Kuninomiyatsuko were all remained.
Therefore, the old titles such as Omi, Muraji, Tomonomiyatsuko, and Kuninomiyatsuko all remained.
Therefore, the old titles such as Omi, Muraji, Tomonomiyatsuko, and Kuninomiyatsuko all remained.

sen.j: 従来から有った、臣、連の姓の上の地位になる姓を作ることで、旧来の氏族との差をつけようとしたという見方もできる。
sen.e: It can be presumed that the Emperor made a distinction from old clans by establishing new titles which were ranked higher than the existing titles, Omi and Muraji.
It can be presumed that the Emperor made a distinction from old clans by establishing new titles which were ranked higher than the existing titles, Omi and Muraji.
It can be presumed that the Emperor made a distinction from old clans by establishing new titles which were ranked higher than the existing titles, Omi and Muraji.

sen.j: また、のちの冠位制度上の錦冠の官僚を出すことのできるのは真人、朝臣、宿禰、忌寸の姓を持つ氏に限られていたようである。
sen.e: It would appear that only the clans who had the titles of Mahito, Asomi/Ason, Sukune, and Imiki could produce the bureaucrats of nishiki no koburi (the seventh grade of twenty-six grades of cap rank) in the future Kan-i System (Office and Rank System).
sen.cmt: 錦冠→nishiki no koburi (the seventh grade of twenty-six grades of cap rank)定訳不明
sen.e: It appears that only the clans who had the titles of Mahito, Asomi/Ason, Sukune, and Imiki could produce the officials of nishiki no koburi (the seventh grade of twenty-six grades of cap rank) in the future Kan-i system (Office and Rank System).
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: It appears that only the clans who had the titles of Mahito, Asomi/Ason, Sukune, and Imiki could produce the officials of nishiki no koburi (the seventh grade of twenty-six grades of cap rank) in the future Kan-i system (Office and Rank System).

tit.j: 氏姓制から令制官僚制へ
tit.e: Transition from the system of clans and hereditary titles to ritsuryo system (ancient East Asian system of centralized governance, in Japan: esp. 7th-10th century) and the bureaucracy
Transition from the system of clans and hereditary titles to ritsuryo system (ancient East Asian system of centralized governance, in Japan: esp. 7th-10th century) and the bureaucracy
Transition from the system of clans and hereditary titles to ritsuryo system (ancient East Asian system of centralized governance, in Japan: esp. 7th-10th century) and the bureaucracy

sen.j: 680年（天武10）飛鳥浄御原令の選定を開始したことに見られるように、また、八色の姓の詔にも見られるように、旧来の氏族制度を改革し、新しい国家体制に即応出来る官僚制創造の政策の一環であった。
sen.e: As seen in beginning of the selection of Asukakiyomihararyo (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) in 680, and the old clan system was reformed as seen in the edict of 'Yakusa no Kabane', new system was one of the policies to create the bureaucracy which was able to promptly respond to a new national policy.

As seen in the beginning of the selection of Asuka Kiyomihara Code (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) in 680 as well as in the edict of Yakusa no Kabane, it was one of the policies to reform the old clan system and to create the bureaucracy which was able to promptly respond to a new national regime.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: As seen in the beginning of the selection of Asuka Kiyomihara Code (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) in 680 as well as in the edict of Yakusa no Kabane, it was one of the policies to reform the old clan system and to create the bureaucracy which was able to promptly respond to a new national regime.

sen.j: 奈良時代から平安時代に至って、源氏・平氏・藤原氏・橘氏の四姓が隆盛になると、その末裔の姓はほとんどが朝臣になってしまい、姓そのものの意味がなくなっていった。
sen.e: When four major family titles which were Minamoto clan, Taira clan, Fujiwara clan, Tachibana clan had gradually prospered from the Nara Period to Heian Period, most of the titles of their descendants became Asomi/Ason, and the title itself had been becoming meaningless.

When four major family titles which were Minamoto clan, Taira clan, Fujiwara clan, Tachibana clan had gradually prospered from the Nara period to Heian period, most of the titles of their descendants became Asomi/Ason, and the title itself became meaningless.
sen.cmt: period を小文字にしました。
sen.e: When four major family titles which were Minamoto clan, Taira clan, Fujiwara clan, Tachibana clan had gradually prospered from the Nara period to Heian period, most of the titles of their descendants became Asomi/Ason, and the title itself became meaningless.
